meanings.definition: Added at the end of a word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: The postfixed letter made the word longer.
meanings.sent2: The postfixed stamp completed the envelope.
meanings.sent3: The postfixed sticker made the notebook look fancier.
meanings.sent4: Her postfixed signature added a personal touch to the letter.
meanings.sent5: The postfixed decoration made the cake more festive.

meanings.sent1: She placed the book postfixed on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The dessert was served postfixed to the main course.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat postfixed behind the couch, waiting to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The stars shone postfixed to the moon in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow appeared postfixed to the storm, bringing hope.

meanings.definition: Attached to the end of a word.
meanings.sent1: The postfixed syllable changed the word's meaning.
meanings.sent2: The postfixed label clarified the product's purpose.
meanings.sent3: The postfixed charm made the bracelet unique.
meanings.sent4: His postfixed nickname became his new identity.
meanings.sent5: The postfixed tail wagged happily behind the dog.
